channel.title: Embedded shortcut action is not executed
channel.description: Hello, the draft creation process works fine, but no tag is added, although the action Tag Temp (add the word temp as tag) works. How should I troubleshoot this issue ? The shortcut used to work and work much faster in iOS 12 which is strange. I tried with different tag actions and it never works. thank you ![9B692D3D-EF6A-4665-824C-D0B7AC2C6B40|465x500](upload://cAlbxLUEDxhWnRBxIjn9b9bBxR9.jpeg)

item.title: Embedded shortcut action is not executed
item.dc:creator: mpl
item.description:
I think perhaps you’re confusing the new Drafts shortcuts actions, which are now available in the Shortcuts app, with examples of the new types of shortcuts you can create with these actions. You can use the actions to build your own shortcuts. No trusting involved. You’ll find them in the Drafts section of the Applications section of Shortcuts. If you just want to make your own shortcuts using the new parameters and actions you don’t need to deal with the untrusted thing at all.

But to download a shortcut from someone else (what you reference in your quote from Greg’s summary) you need to allow untrusted shortcuts in your settings. It’s an ominous word that Apple is using to make clear that these aren’t created by them.

OK fine. I understand.

Keeping in mind that I am not very smart and should not serve as a reference, some people may have misread your Tips and Tricks emails and may believe, like I did that if I allow shortcuts to install untrusted shortcuts via settings, I will have access to a whole repertoire of drafts related shortcuts written by you, a few examples of which you list in your email.

A few years ago, I could read ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs. I could read inscriptions on monuments and passages in the book of the Dead. Despite that I was unable to decrypt your email correctly !

A suggestion: to create a directory of drafts related shortcuts on your Drafts Community web site, analogous to your Drafts action directory.

Quote from your tips and tricks email.
Installation Note: To use these Shortcuts, you must be running iOS 13 or greater, and Drafts 15.0 or greater. To install example Shortcuts from the links below, you must enable “Allow Untrusted Shortcuts” in iOS Settings > Shortcuts .

item.title: Embedded shortcut action is not executed
item.dc:creator: agiletortoise
item.description:
1. The old, obsolete Drafts actions in Shortcuts are not part of Drafts, they are part of Shortcuts and would have to be removed by Apple. I believe they are working toward removing those deprecated URL-based app actions for all apps.

  2. Not sure about the “trusted” part - that is a setting in Shortcuts that basically enables or disables the import and export of Shortcuts. Creating and running Drafts shortcuts is not affected by that setting as far as I understand.

  3. I don’t have a repertoire of shortcuts. I shared a couple of examples the other day here on the forum to help get people started. This stuff just came out. And I don’t have any control over what Apple features in the Gallery - I expect they will mostly feature shortcuts that do not require third party apps there.

item.description:
Hello Greg,

  • I think that you should tell users loud and clear that untrusted shortcuts must be allowed. You mention it but only in passing in a long email. It’s easy to miss.

  • I am going crazy trying to find the location of your repertoire of custom ‘non trusted’ drafts shortcuts: They are not in the shortcuts gallery, not in your drafts actions directory and I can’t find them on your site, except for one example which you mention (open modified draft).

  • is it possible to delete an old deprecated shortcut action to make things less confusing?

thank you

item.title: Embedded shortcut action is not executed
item.dc:creator: agiletortoise
item.description:
This is an old, deprecated URL-based shortcut action for Drafts. On iOS 13, it should be removed and replaced with new parameter-based shortcuts actions provided by Drafts. I think the Shortcuts team left in support for these in existing shortcuts - but they don’t always work quite right with some of the Shortcuts changes on 13.

The “correct” way to do this on 13 is to have a Create Draft action, which his direct support for setting tags.
